metadata.title: CVE-2016-6170 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
ISC BIND through 9.9.9-P1, 9.10.x through 9.10.4-P1, and 9.11.x through9.11.0b1 allows primary DNS servers to cause a denial of service (secondaryDNS server crash) via a large AXFR response, and possibly allows IXFRservers to cause a denial of service (IXFR client crash) via a large IXFRresponse and allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service(primary DNS server crash) via a large UPDATE message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
bind9-host - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
bind9utils - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
dnsutils - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libdns-export169 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libdns169 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libirs160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisc-export166 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisc166 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisccc-export160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisccc160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisccfg-export160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
libisccfg160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
liblwres160 - 1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.11.2.P1-1ubuntu3').
